comments.body:
Otra idea ser√≠a que le pudieras dar un objeto al sniffer y el lo pidiera oler y haci dirigirse a una estructura con el objeto relacionado.

Si le das un est√°ndarte de los saqueadores, el sniffer ir√≠a a buscar la torre de los saqueadores, si le das una mesa de trabajo de los aldeanos como el flechero, herrero etc..., Ira a una aldea

Dear Minecraft developers i think the sniffer is a great mob but I think you should be able to ride and tame the sniffer also if you find an adult sniffer maybe it would be a good idea that if you give it a treasure map it could help you find the treasure 

 

anywho those were some ideas that I think would make the sniffer an even better mob
It's likely nothing can grow on their back because it's just grass or moss on them, not a habitat.

Seems pretty cool even if its just concrete texture it still seems cool

And I play Minecraft alotüòâ
And Nether

Agree. The end is more simple - less biomes no mountains - so it‚Äôs easier to keep oversight. Finding history gives away to the lore of the enderman travelling through biomes. The findings could be even older than anything in the over world, i.e. the enderman went to overworld before the villagers. You could use the binoculars to scout archeological sights on other floating islands. When running to find end cities you can easily pack your archeology tools since you should have space in your inventory - given the fact there‚Äôs so little to collect in the end. It‚Äôd be nice to find a painting and/or an armor trim through archeology. It‚Äôd be especially cool if you can find a hibernated mob that has lived millennia‚Äôs ago. We don‚Äôt know wether it‚Äôs originally from the overworld or the end. What if we find a written book in the end. Did someone else manage to get to the end before you? If so, how? An alley from the overworld could help you find archeological sight in end. I think the end can make archeology more mystical & mysterious and can turn it into a real activity.

Being able to make your own suspicious blocks? Yeah, that sounds great, especially for just general sandbox purposes. 

The recipe could involve the item being buried, the block to bury it into and a shovel, resulting in a custom suspicious block at the cost of a bit of shovel durability.
Eso ser√≠a buena idea pero tengo una duda si rompes el bloque de arena sospechosa no te da nada pero que pasa si una entidad lo explota cambia de lugar etc

The truth is that it would be quite interesting.
Also, adventure map makers would have a better chance of making better maps.
Plus we could hide things.
In my opinion, it is a detail that gives many possibilities to the Minecraft game. =)
This would be a good idea
I fully agree. Along with certain difficult to find items at very low yields. Like an elytra at 0.0001% or something to add surprise to archaeology.
maybe there can be a OP portal
They could add items that are unique to bosses and make special ways to spawn them in like how you respawn the ender dragon
They could add items that are unique to bosses and make special ways to spawn them in like how you respawn the ender dragon
but why? We already got a nether update. I think an End update will be good.
What might it be?
That defeats the whole point of the trims' locations. It's meant for encouraging expanded exploration.

It should be a unique trim texture to ensure the other trims don't lose their uniqueness or have them be pointless to travel for (or have a varied pool that only includes some trims).

This would keep trims from going extinct on certain old worlds, maps, or servers. A player on skyblock, superflat, or an old server/map with no more structures that aren't looted or players who destroyed them all or are hording them will leave no armor trims for anyone to customize with. With a villager trading a unique trim, it would ensure players can always have a trim for their armor even if its more common than no one having trims because they don't generate while making them renewable.
make then spawn in ancient cities.
there has to be flint in the loot table
Or have suspicious gravel in the dungeon, than will the dungeon have more purpose üòÇ
It's now in a Bedrock preview :D
That's a cool idea! I hope it will be added to 1.20!
Should be added as Nether ore

My Russian may be a little off but here is the rough translation:

Please add rubies to Minecraft! 

You've shown the archaeology concept, but the vases showed the same Emerald gems...

My ideas for use: they could be used to make new armour and weapons, some interesting artefacts, or could add the ability to regenerate when wearing any part of the ruby armour.

The ore would also be generated less often than emeralds, which would make it much more valuable. I also suggest adding rubies as a loot for pyramids.

Please add these gems to the game :)
maybe rubies could be used as materials for making magical charms and special potions

Also the only place that the rubies could be able to spawn would be in the new Cherry Blossom biome, which would make it so that you have to explore and find a Cherry Blossom biome before getting your hand on those juicy rubies.
THAT WOULD BE A GOOD IDEA

Nice Idea, but the suggested loot seems overpowered. I love the idea of naturally spawned campfires and some kind of trapper stuff. For the loot i would suggest iron, bows, arrows, leather meat, wool, sapplings etc.

I like  having campsites have 1-2 hostile mobs to deal with. But for such a small structure, i disagree that they should have such amazing loot. I also think to add to your post, it would be cool that you could change the color of the fire depending on what dye or certain item you toss into it or feed it. Just like how in real life when you mix certain chemicals, you can get different colored flames.
And weapons. What will change such characteristics as attack speed, damage, durability, ability to parry.
Man I just wanted to post that but I think that the shield does not need any customization since it has the banner addition
elytra, maybe, tools, maaaaaaybe this isn't a bad suggestion and while its not something i wouldmind having, it doesn't make alot of sense
Basalt deltas.
Yes, new trees with thinner trunks.

Hmmm, I see your point, but for some it would probably be best to add different types of leaves for nut trees and for Maple trees it would probably have some animation to it to know when to tap the sap. Also for trees like Pine it would be nice to see how the falling pines could turn grass into dirt.
I definitely think cypress trees should be added but the rest I'm not so sure about.

Ugh! Yes! It's so annoying that azalea trees have oak! They DEFINITELY need their own wood! Then you could find a bunch of azaleas, make a whole house out of the wood you collected, and brag about it to your friends. Right know, if you did, your friends probably wouldn't believe you. Azaleas are so special, there wood should be special, too.
this genuinely should be a thing even tho I don't play bedrock
Yes. We need automatic lava/powder snow farms!
I have no idea why this wasn't implemented yet. We really need this for certain farms like lava.
This is a duplicate of  https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360075568672-Dispensers-should-be-able-to-take-water-or-lava-out-of-cauldron
It will help with creating fully automated farms that involve that because it is a pain to have to collect the lava/water manually taking more time.

I like of these except for the Platinum, Aluminum, Cobalt stuff

Also there could be:

Salt - found in large veins and, when combined with meat of any kind, potatoes and carrots, would increase the saturation (not hunger fulfillment, i.e. steak gives '4') of that food.

I do think the pitcher plant has the ability to do more. Great ideas!! In the real world pitcher plants trap bugs and collect water. Lots of ideas could sprout off of that for game development. Maybe they could trap and kill certain mobs and produce something that could be collected. For instance, your idea of invisibility options.

Maybe during rain a pitcher plant would collect water more and more and it would eventually spill out when it get to full and when paired to a compariter it could give a signal based on how much water is in it.

Torchflower should emit light

Agreed. I've seen lots of good proposals for this. Some bring up a fixed light level, others suggest having them open up at night.

but less than a regular torch, let's say 5, so that mobs still spawn with its light.

IIRC, mob spawning behavior was reduced to light level zero only. I do agree that the flowers should emit lower light levels than torches, though.

Pitcher Plant instead of 2 turquoise dyes, should give a new - ancient dye. It will turn leather armor invisible, and if crossed with a Special Template, the armor will become invisible, but more visible on close contact. A useful thing, because in the potion of invisibility - the armor is visible.


Having something to address this armor visibility situation would be nice!
It would be fun to have even more variants of the zombie.
Pero Para que ya tenemos el bloque para que un muro
No, that is not a good idea. However, there could be a certain biome with cherry blossoms that have grass like this, but not all biomes.
Maybe the grass could also turn pink if a cherry tree drops it's particles for a few minutes on it.

Not loving this idea.

I think the cherry blossom grove needs the green for the aesthetic.

I do like this idea but I would only make the grass blocks under the cherry trees pink (a gradient as you got closer to the tree would look cool but it would mean adding more than one colour grass block).
I'm sorry but that's so spore-like
grass should be green
Too much pink. It needs a visual balance, off-set with the green.
Makes sense to me!
the only animal that comes to my mind is some white and red bird
This would be a good place for the Sniffer.
Please add more birds for the cherry blossom biome

How about samurai dogs and Ninja cats? Other then their models, the only difference between them and other dogs and cats is that even when tamed, the cats are always aggressive toward the dogs, and vice versa. It's kind of a stupid idea, I know, but I had to share it.
Kinda useless, but would be a fun interaction anyways
you can already do that by putting them on water
But not with sand
